Fast Food Quick Guide: Wendy's
What Are the Most Healthy Fast Food Choices at Wendy's?
From Jennifer R. Scott , former About.com Guide
Updated July 14, 2009
About.com Health's Disease and Condition content is reviewed by our Medical Review Board See More About: healthy fast food choices eating out on a diet counting calories Wendy's is a fast food restaurant popular for burgers and a soft-serve dairy dessert, the Frosty. Wendy's offers a few filling, diet-friendly items, such as a grilled chicken salad or small beef and bean chili for around 200 calories. But beware those fat-laden specialty burgers -- some pack in close to a thousand calories! This quick guide will help you identify the most healthy fast food choices at Wendy's.
Good Choices:
fresh fruit bowl with yogurt - 220 calories fresh fruit bowl - 130 calories side salad - 35 calories broccoli and cheese potato - 330 calories Caesar chicken salad (no dressing or toppings) - 190 calories taco salad (no sour cream, chips, or salsa) - 360 calories small chili - 220 calories kids meal fries - 280 calories ham and cheese kids meal sandwich - 240 calories
Less Preferable Choices:
The Baconator - 840 calories Class Triple with Cheese - 970 calories blue cheese salad dressing - 260 calories Homestyle Chicken Strips (3) - 410 calories Premium Fish Filet Sandwich - 450 calories Honey BBQ Boneless Wings - 580 calories Frosty Float - 380 calories Classic Single with Everything - 420 calories Sweet and Spicy Asian Boneless Wings - 550 calories Crispy Chicken Sandwich - 380 calories
I found all of the calorie counts for these menu items using About.com's Calorie Count . You can find many more listings for Wendy's menu items there, plus you can search for any other restaurants and types of foods, all for free.
